docs.text: essdive-sample-reporting-format ESS-DIVE recommends registering samples for Global Sample Numbers (IGSNs) through the System for Earth Sample Registration (SESAR). IGSNs are associated with standardized metadata to characterize a variety of different samples and their collection details. These sample identifiers facilitate sample discovery, tracking, and reuse; they are especially useful when sample data is shared with collaborators, sent to different labs or user facilities for analyses, or distributed in different data files, datasets, and/or publications. ESS-DIVE has worked with our community scientists to test use of IGSNs and associated metadata in interdisciplinary Environmental Systems Science (ESS). Here we outline modified IGSN metadata guidelines to account for needs of a variety of related geological and biological samples. While generally following the IGSN core descriptive metadata schema, we provide recommendations for extending sample type terms, and connecting to related templates geared towards biodiversity (Darwin Core) and genomic (Minimum Information about any Sequence, MIxS) samples and specimens. The resulting template and recommendations are an extension of IGSN core metadata - IGSN for Environmental Systems Science (IGSN-ESS). docs.text: Slot: Biome (biome) Major environmental system your sample or specimen came from. The systems identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. were you in the desert or a rainforest?). URI: essdive_sample_reporting_format:biome Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot EssDiveSample Represents ESS-DIVE specification for data yes Properties Range: String Recommended: True Examples Value shrubland biome [ENVO:01000176] tropical moist broadleaf forest biome [ENVO:01000228]; estuarine biome [ENVO:01000020] Comments Terms from Environment Ontology (ENVO) . Provide the appropriate term and ENVO identifier - see examples below. We recommend using subclasses of ENVO’s biome class . Use a semi-colon to delimit multiple biomes where needed. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here . Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self essdive_sample_reporting_format:biome native essdive_sample_reporting_format:biome LinkML Source name: biome description: Major environmental system your sample or specimen came from. The systems identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. were you in the desert or a rainforest?). title: Biome comments: - Terms from Environment Ontology (ENVO). Provide the appropriate term and ENVO identifier - see examples below. We recommend using subclasses of ENVO’s biome class. Use a semi-colon to delimit multiple biomes where needed. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here. examples: - value: shrubland biome [ENVO:01000176] - value: tropical moist broadleaf forest biome [ENVO:01000228]; estuarine biome [ENVO:01000020] from_schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format rank: 1000 alias: biome domain_of: - EssDiveSample range: string recommended: true

docs.text: Slot: Collection date (collection_date) Date when the sample was collected. URI: essdive_sample_reporting_format:collection_date Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot EssDiveSample Represents ESS-DIVE specification for data yes Properties Range: Date Required: True Examples Value 2019-08-14 Comments All dates and times must be reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and follow the ISO 8601 standard (RFC 3339). Temporal data using different standards can be provided as a separate variable (column) in addition to UTC format; YYYY-MM-DD Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self essdive_sample_reporting_format:collection_date native essdive_sample_reporting_format:collection_date LinkML Source name: collection_date description: Date when the sample was collected. title: Collection date comments: - All dates and times must be reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and follow the ISO 8601 standard (RFC 3339). docs.text: Slot: Collection ID (collection_id) A unique identifier for the set of information associated with a collection of samples; collections may be organized around a particular project, data set, field season, region, site, etc. URI: essdive_sample_reporting_format:collection_id Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot EssDiveSample Represents ESS-DIVE specification for data yes Properties Range: String Examples Value WSFA_June2019 Comments Must be unique within the data package (project-assigned, and does not need to be globally unique). See link to diagram that demonstrates linking related collection, site, event, and sample IDs. A collection identifier can be used to link a set of samples together, and/or to enable efficient entry of metadata that is the same across all samples in a "sample collection." docs.text: Slot: Collection method description (collection_method_description) Description of the collection method for the sample. Include any important terms and details for potential users to understand how your sample was collected. URI: essdive_sample_reporting_format:collection_method_description Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot EssDiveSample Represents ESS-DIVE specification for data yes Properties Range: String Required: True Examples Value Example 1) Collect soil samples from top 10 cm using 2-3 cores from with meadow plot or under the bulk of tree/shrub canopies. Example 2) Excised branch. Example 3) Pumped water at specific depths using tubing connected to CTD. Comments Collection methods may often be the same across a series/collection of samples; there are two options for providing collection method details at a higher level. Option 1 - Create a separate file with metadata to describe a sample collection, which contains a "collectionID", and any associated metadata fields (e.g. "collectionMethodDescription", "Purpose", "Chief Scientist", etc.). Option 2 - Create a methods file, with a series of methods descriptions that are each associated with a "methodID" and an associated "methodDescription." Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self essdive_sample_reporting_format:collection_method_description native essdive_sample_reporting_format:collection_method_description LinkML Source name: collection_method_description description: Description of the collection method for the sample. Include any important terms and details for potential users to understand how your sample was collected. title: Collection method description comments: - Collection methods may often be the same across a series/collection of samples; there are two options for providing collection method details at a higher level. Option 1 - Create a separate file with metadata to describe a sample collection, which contains a "collectionID", and any associated metadata fields (e.g. "collectionMethodDescription", "Purpose", "Chief Scientist", etc.). Option 2 - Create a methods file, with a series of methods descriptions that are each associated with a "methodID" and an associated "methodDescription." examples: - value: Example 1) Collect soil samples from top 10 cm using 2-3 cores from with meadow plot or under the bulk of tree/shrub canopies. - value: Example 2) Excised branch. - value: Example 3) Pumped water at specific depths using tubing connected to CTD. from_schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format rank: 1000 alias: collection_method_description domain_of: - EssDiveSample range: string required: true

docs.text: essdive-sample-reporting-format ESS-DIVE recommends registering samples for Global Sample Numbers (IGSNs) through the System for Earth Sample Registration (SESAR). IGSNs are associated with standardized metadata to characterize a variety of different samples and their collection details. These sample identifiers facilitate sample discovery, tracking, and reuse; they are especially useful when sample data is shared with collaborators, sent to different labs or user facilities for analyses, or distributed in different data files, datasets, and/or publications. ESS-DIVE has worked with our community scientists to test use of IGSNs and associated metadata in interdisciplinary Environmental Systems Science (ESS). Here we outline modified IGSN metadata guidelines to account for needs of a variety of related geological and biological samples. While generally following the IGSN core descriptive metadata schema, we provide recommendations for extending sample type terms, and connecting to related templates geared towards biodiversity (Darwin Core) and genomic (Minimum Information about any Sequence, MIxS) samples and specimens. The resulting template and recommendations are an extension of IGSN core metadata - IGSN for Environmental Systems Science (IGSN-ESS). URI: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format
docs.title: essdive-sample-reporting-format

docs.text: ESS-DIVE recommends registering samples for Global Sample Numbers (IGSNs) through the System for Earth Sample Registration (SESAR). IGSNs are associated with standardized metadata to characterize a variety of different samples and their collection details. These sample identifiers facilitate sample discovery, tracking, and reuse; they are especially useful when sample data is shared with collaborators, sent to different labs or user facilities for analyses, or distributed in different data files, datasets, and/or publications. ESS-DIVE has worked with our community scientists to test use of IGSNs and associated metadata in interdisciplinary Environmental Systems Science (ESS). Here we outline modified IGSN metadata guidelines to account for needs of a variety of related geological and biological samples. While generally following the IGSN core descriptive metadata schema, we provide recommendations for extending sample type terms, and connecting to related templates geared towards biodiversity (Darwin Core) and genomic (Minimum Information about any Sequence, MIxS) samples and specimens. The resulting template and recommendations are an extension of IGSN core metadata - IGSN for Environmental Systems Science (IGSN-ESS). URI: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format

docs.text: Slot: Event ID (event_id) A unique identifier for the set of information associated with an Event (something that occurs at a place and time). URI: essdive_sample_reporting_format:event_id Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot EssDiveSample Represents ESS-DIVE specification for data yes Properties Range: String Examples Value WSFA_20191023 Comments Must be unique within the data package (project-assigned, and does not need to be globally unique). See link to diagram that demonstrates linking related collection, site, event, and sample IDs. An event identifier can be used to link a set of samples collected on a specific date, and/or to enable efficient entry of metadata that is the same across these samples. docs.text: Slot: Field program/cruise (field_program_cruise) Enter the name of the DOE project to associate with this/these sample(s). URI: essdive_sample_reporting_format:field_program_cruise Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot EssDiveSample Represents ESS-DIVE specification for data yes Properties Range: String Required: True Examples Value Next Generation Ecosystem Experiments (NGEE) Tropics LBNL Watershed Function SFA Comments Required at dataset level, but want to associate with samples for data search and integration. Project details may often be the same across a series/collection of samples; To avoid entering the same information across numerous samples, you can create a separate file with metadata to describe a project or sample collection, which contains a "collectionID" or "Field Program/Cruise", and any associated metadata fields (e.g. "Collection Method Description", "Purpose", "Chief Scientist"... docs.text: Slot: IGSN (igsn) Globally unique and persistent identifier for the sample. Leave blank if you want SESAR to assign the IGSN, which is recommended. URI: essdive_sample_reporting_format:igsn Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot EssDiveSample Represents ESS-DIVE specification for data yes Properties Range: String Recommended: True Examples Value IEWER7214 IEMEG0215 Comments For split samples/subsamples, you can assign your own 1-2 character extensions from the parent_igsn, and submit your own IGSNs for registering these child samples. This is not required, but is an option if desired. For assigning your own IGSNS, you must use upper-case alpha-numeric characters. Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self essdive_sample_reporting_format:igsn native essdive_sample_reporting_format:igsn LinkML Source name: igsn description: Globally unique and persistent identifier for the sample. Leave blank if you want SESAR to assign the IGSN, which is recommended. title: IGSN comments: - For split samples/subsamples, you can assign your own 1-2 character extensions from the parent_igsn, and submit your own IGSNs for registering these child samples. This is not required, but is an option if desired. For assigning your own IGSNS, you must use upper-case alpha-numeric characters. examples: - value: IEWER7214 - value: IEMEG0215 from_schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format rank: 1000 alias: igsn domain_of: - EssDiveSample range: string recommended: true

docs.text: Slot: Latitude (latitude) Latitude of the location where the sample was collected, entered in decimal degrees. Negative values for South latitudes. URI: essdive_sample_reporting_format:latitude Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot EssDiveSample Represents ESS-DIVE specification for data yes Properties Range: Float Recommended: True Minimum Value: -90 Maximum Value: 90 Regex pattern: ^-?\d+(\.\d{1,6})?$ Examples Value 5.89634 Comments Decimal degrees, coordinate system is WGS 84. Please supply no more than 6 decimal places (meter scale resolution) in the actual number (not just display format.) No letters are allowed. Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self essdive_sample_reporting_format:latitude native essdive_sample_reporting_format:latitude LinkML Source name: latitude description: Latitude of the location where the sample was collected, entered in decimal degrees. docs.text: Slot: Location ID (location_id) A unique identifier for the set of location information. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set. URI: essdive_sample_reporting_format:location_id Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot EssDiveSample Represents ESS-DIVE specification for data yes Properties Range: String Examples Value CoyoteRiver_D22 Comments Must be unique within the data package (project-assigned, and does not need to be globally unique). See link to diagram that demonstrates linking related collection, site, event, and sample IDs. A site identifier can be used to link a set of samples collected from a specific site, and/or to enable efficient entry of metadata that is the same across these samples. Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self essdive_sample_reporting_format:location_id native essdive_sample_reporting_format:location_id LinkML Source name: location_id description: A unique identifier for the set of location information. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set. title: Location ID comments: - Must be unique within the data package (project-assigned, and does not need to be globally unique). See link to diagram that demonstrates linking related collection, site, event, and sample IDs. A site identifier can be used to link a set of samples collected from a specific site, and/or to enable efficient entry of metadata that is the same across these samples. examples: - value: CoyoteRiver_D22 from_schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format rank: 1000 alias: location_id domain_of: - EssDiveSample range: string required: false

docs.text: Slot: Primary physiographic feature (primary_physiographic_feature) Entity or entities which are in your sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. URI: essdive_sample_reporting_format:primary_physiographic_feature Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot EssDiveSample Represents ESS-DIVE specification for data yes Properties Range: String Recommended: True Examples Value river [ENVO:00000022] wet meadow ecosystem [ENVO:01000449]; mountain [ENVO:00000081] For annotating a pooled sample taken from various vegetation layers in a forest, consider - canopy [ENVO:00000047]; herb and fern layer [ENVO:01000337]; litter layer [ENVO:01000338]; understory [01000335]; shrub layer [ENVO:01000336]. Comments Terms from Environment Ontology (ENVO) . Provide the appropriate term and ENVO identifier - see examples below. Choose environmental context that is a smaller spatial grain than your entry for biome. Delimit multiple values using semi-colon. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here . Provide the appropriate term and ENVO identifier - see examples below. Choose environmental context that is a smaller spatial grain than your entry for biome. Delimit multiple values using semi-colon. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here. examples: - value: river [ENVO:00000022] - value: wet meadow ecosystem [ENVO:01000449]; mountain [ENVO:00000081] - value: For annotating a pooled sample taken from various vegetation layers in a forest, consider - canopy [ENVO:00000047]; herb and fern layer [ENVO:01000337]; litter layer [ENVO:01000338]; understory [01000335]; shrub layer [ENVO:01000336]. from_schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format rank: 1000 alias: primary_physiographic_feature domain_of: - EssDiveSample range: string recommended: true

docs.text: Slot: Sample processing (sample_processing) Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from the environment. Can provide a list of preparations and preservation methods for the sample. URI: essdive_sample_reporting_format:sample_processing Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot EssDiveSample Represents ESS-DIVE specification for data yes Properties Range: String Recommended: True Examples Value filter water store samples in ethanol Comments Sample processing may often be the same across a series/collection of samples. To avoid entering the same information across numerous samples, you can create a separate file with metadata to describe a sample collection, which contains a "collectionID", and any associated metadata fields (e.g. "sampleProcessing", "collectionMethodDescription", "Purpose", "Chief Scientist", etc.). Separate multiple sample processing methods with a semi-colon. Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self essdive_sample_reporting_format:sample_processing native essdive_sample_reporting_format:sample_processing LinkML Source name: sample_processing description: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from the environment. Can provide a list of preparations and preservation methods for the sample. title: Sample processing comments: - Sample processing may often be the same across a series/collection of samples. To avoid entering the same information across numerous samples, you can create a separate file with metadata to describe a sample collection, which contains a "collectionID", and any associated metadata fields (e.g. "sampleProcessing", "collectionMethodDescription", "Purpose", "Chief Scientist", etc.). Separate multiple sample processing methods with a semi-colon. examples: - value: filter water - value: store samples in ethanol from_schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format rank: 1000 alias: sample_processing domain_of: - EssDiveSample range: string recommended: true

docs.text: name: sample_processing description: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from the environment. Can provide a list of preparations and preservation methods for the sample. title: Sample processing comments: - Sample processing may often be the same across a series/collection of samples. To avoid entering the same information across numerous samples, you can create a separate file with metadata to describe a sample collection, which contains a "collectionID", and any associated metadata fields (e.g. "sampleProcessing", "collectionMethodDescription", "Purpose", "Chief Scientist", etc.). Separate multiple sample processing methods with a semi-colon. examples: - value: filter water - value: store samples in ethanol from_schema: https://w3id.org/ess-dive-community/essdive-sample-reporting-format rank: 1000 alias: sample_processing domain_of: - EssDiveSample range: string recommended: true
